current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To stop the National Security Agency from spying on
		  citizens of the United States and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced the
			 following bill; which was read the first time

action-desc.#text:
Read the second time and placed on the
			 calendar

Read the second time and placed on the
		  calendar

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

quote.#text:
The right of the people to be secure in their persons, houses, papers,
			 and effects, against unreasonable searches and seizures, shall not be violated,
			 and no Warrants shall issue, but upon probable cause, supported by Oath or
			 affirmation, and particularly describing the place to be searched, and the
			 persons or things to be seized.

text.#text:
The Bill of
			 Rights states in the 4th Amendment to the United States Constitution that

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is currently collecting the phone
			 records of American citizens.

has secured a top secret court order
			 in April 2013 from a court established under

for the telephone
			 records of millions of American citizens.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 103 of the Foreign
			 Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
’s Administration has been collecting
			 information about millions of citizens within the borders of the United States
			 and between the United States and other countries.

text.#text:
The collection of
			 citizen’s phone records is a violation of the natural rights of every man and
			 woman in the United States, and a clear violation of the explicit language of
			 the highest law of the land.

The Fourth
			 Amendment to the Constitution shall not be construed to allow any agency of the
			 United States Government to search the phone records of Americans without a
			 warrant based on probable cause.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1121 PCS: Fourth Amendment Restoration Act of 2013
